DOC.brief_summary: This is a pilot study designed to explore the feasibility of non-invasively diagnosing the presence of cancer in the breast using non-invasive magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) methods and an analysis of vessel shape defined from these magnetic resonance images.
DOC.brief_title: Feasibility Study of Vessel Analysis for Noninvasive Diagnosis of Malignancy in Breast Tumors
DOC.criteria: adult women (age >= 18), with Histologically documented newly diagnosed stage IIIV invasive breast cancer appropriate for neoadjuvant (preoperative) systemic therapy. ECOG performance status of 0, 1, or 2 at the initiation of the study. pregnant women women with contralateral mastectomies known bilateral tumors subjects prone to claustrophobia contraindicated to have MRI mentally impaired not fluent in english
